intro: Argyranthemum lidii, commonly known as the African marguerite, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, daisy-like blooms with white petals and a yellow center, often resembling miniature sunflowers. It is typically shrub-like, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Argyranthemum lidii is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant flowers and adaptability to various growing conditions.
